values.desc: Returns a copy of this WindowInsets with the cutout fully consumed.
Returns a copy of this WindowInsets with the stable insets fully consumed.
Returns a copy of this WindowInsets with the system window insets fully consumed.
Returns the display cutout if there is one.
Returns the insets of a specific set of windows causing insets, denoted by the typeMask bit mask of android.
Returns the insets a specific set of windows can cause, denoted by the typeMask bit mask of android.
Returns the mandatory system gesture insets.
Returns the bottom stable inset in pixels.
Returns the left stable inset in pixels.

Returns the top stable inset in pixels.
Returns the stable insets in pixels.
Returns the system gesture insets.
Returns the bottom system window inset in pixels.
Returns the left system window inset in pixels.
Returns the right system window inset in pixels.
Returns the top system window inset in pixels.
Returns the system window insets in pixels.
Returns the tappable element insets.
Returns true if this WindowInsets has any nonzero insets.
Returns true if this WindowInsets has nonzero stable insets.
Returns true if this WindowInsets has nonzero system window insets.
Returns a copy of this instance inset in the given directions.

values.code: inset(left: Int, top: Int, right: Int, bottom: Int)
values.desc: Returns a copy of this instance inset in the given directions.
Check if these insets have been fully consumed.
Returns true if the associated window has a round shape.
Returns whether a set of windows that may cause insets is currently visible on screen, regardless of whether it actually overlaps with this window.

values.code: replaceSystemWindowInsets(left: Int, top: Int, right: Int, bottom: Int)
